You have done it, my {reg59?lady:lord}! I am very surprised, because the Norse value their freedom of action. Well, I will add your story in my history book and proclaim you Konungr of the Norse. In recognition of your accomplishment, I give you the treasure of the Norse.

You have done it, my {reg59?lady:lord}! I am very surprised, because the Britons are tough people. Well, I will add your story in my history book and proclaim you Vrenhin Lloegr, ruler of the Britons. In recognition of your accomplishment, I give you the treasure of the Britons.

You have done it, my {reg59?lady:lord}! I am very surprised, because the Goidels are independent people who accept with difficulty the leadership of others. Well, I will add your story in my history book and proclaim you Ard Ruire of the Goidels. In recognition of your accomplishment, I give you the treasure of the Goidels.

You have done it, my {reg59?lady:lord}! I am very surprised, because the Angles and Saxons are distrustful people. Well, I will add your story in my history book and proclaim you Brytenwalda, ruler over all Englaland. In recognition of your accomplishment, I give you the treasure of the Angles and Saxons.
Thank you so much for the award and for helping my fame and prestige grow. Farewell, chronicler!
Chi sei tu?
What about you, Briton?
Goidelic and chronicler? Is this a joke?
What do you do?
Addio.
I guess that's not an easy question to answer. My role here is to leave for posterity the history of great men. I write the life of the greatest king in this area. I am his chronicler.
I want you to write my story.
Very well. Farewell.

First, you have to be the most important person in this part of the world. That means displacing the person that currently holds that position and unifying under your rule this territory. Do you want to take on this challenge?
Sure.
No. Farewell.

Surely, you are bold to take on the challenge of uniting all the small kingdoms and conflicting jarls of the Norse under your command.^For me to be your chronicler and give you the title of Konungr of the Norse, you must unify the territory of these towns under your kingdom: Ribe, Tunsberg and Dorestad.^^Good luck. Return when you have subjugated these territories, and I will proclaim that you are the most powerful {reg59?queen:king} among the Norse.

Surely, you are bold to take on the challenge of uniting all the small kingdoms and conflicting lords of the Britons under your command.^For me to be your chronicler and give you the title of Vrenhin Lloegr, the king of the Britons, you must unify the territory of these towns under your kingdom: Ynys Mon, Bosvenegh and Caer Dyf.^^Good luck. Return when you have subjugated these territories, and I will proclaim that you are the most powerful {reg59?queen:king} among the Britons.

Surely, you are bold to take on the challenge of uniting all the small kingdoms and conflicting lords of the Goidels under your command.^For me to be your chronicler and give you the title of Ard Ruire, the high king of Eriu, you must unify the territory of these towns under your kingdom: Aileach, Cruaghan and Temair.^^Good luck. Return when you have subjugated these territories, and I will proclaim that you are the most powerful {reg59?queen:king} of Eriu.

Surely, you are bold to take on the challenge of uniting all the small kingdoms and conflicting lords of the Angles and Saxons under your command.^For me to be your chronicler and give you the title of Brytenwalda, ruler over all Englaland, you must unify the territory of these towns under your kingdom: Lundenwic, Witan Ceaster and Jorvik.^^Good luck. Return when you have subjugated these territories, and I will proclaim that you are the most powerful {reg59?queen:king} of Englaland.
Very well. I must buy ink and parchment, I will return soon.
{playername}, when you escaped my trap, I came to hide here. From the fact that you have managed to find me, I perceive that, contrary to appearances, you are someone with resources.
Welcome, {playername}. The abbot of Finian informed me that you eliminated the main enemies of my lord and mine. I expect that you've found our rewards a more than acceptable way to get rich.
Si?
I am {playername}. I was told you want to meet me.
[Say nothing]

Ah, {playername}! The abbot spoke wonders about you and your diligence in solving my problems. I wanted to meet you personally in order to put a face to my hero.^^--He smiles widely--^^Also, I look forward to hearing news about the matter we have pending.
It is likewise a pleasure to meet you, my lord. Your enemies are at a farm near Dinas Bran.
Flaithbertach's grandchildren are at a farm near Dinas Bran, my lord.
Flaithbertach's grandchildren are at a farm near Dinas Bran.
I guess you still do not know me and the abbot gave no warning, but I prefer short and direct answers. My occupations are numerous and my time very limited.

Your news is excellent. In fact, I want to reward you personally, in addition to what the abbot promised you, with 8,000 peningas. The people who work for me do not have to worry about money or wealth. All that I ask of them is to be faithful and execute my orders promptly.
Thank you so much, my lord.
Grazie.

Well, I'm sorry I don't have more time. Ask the abbot to give you your reward and your next assignment. Your next task is particularly important, so put all effort into it. Now I have to go. I wish you all well.
Honestly? I expected more.
I do what I have to do.
It has been a pleasure to serve you and kill your enemies.
You lied to make me a murderer of your enemies.
You are ambitious, but I think you've been well paid. I will not give you a pening more until you deserve one.
That's important to me. In this world, it is not easy to find effective people.
I know. Not all patrons reward their servants as well. Although it is sometimes difficult to know if your loyalty is to me or my money.
You were commissioned to do something, and you agreed to do it. Nobody forced you to accept. Why now come, whining? I cannot stand the capricious nor the faint-hearted.
--He chuckles.--^^I hear Morrigan tried to save her life with lies. What were her last words?
She told me she was the last of the line of Flaithbertach.
She died before I could talk to her.
Working for Aed mac Niall, Ard Ruire of Eriu, you sent me to kill the remnants of the family Flaithbertach in order to remove potential rivals for the throne.
Do not lie! I know when you're lying. Liars have a place not at my side but on the gallows!

You've done a huge favor to Eriu, if you're not aware of it. This island is populated by numerous clans, but each feels entitled to rule over others. The social system is a pyramid -- the weaker subject to the stronger, but all led by the high king, the Ard Ruire. However, the elements of this system constantly mutate, and clan alliances break according to changing interests. In sum, it is very difficult to rule this land.

I believe Aed mac Niall is a good leader, as he favors my interests, and therefore yours. However, Flaithbertach was a man beloved by the Ui-Neill, and his death caused much discomfort. His children could easily have taken up arms with many northern clans. As an internal war within the Kingdom of Aileach would only favor our rivals, the Southern Ui Neill, in their desire to secure once again the throne at Tara. Ard Ruire Aed is strong leader, uniquely able to keep the Vikings at bay. Do you understand?
There is no need to justify our actions to me.
I hate politics.
Sure.
Justify? No, I am happy to do so.
Politics is what moves the world, but it's a game that you win or die.

Everything I've done has been for the benefit of Eriu. If I had directly attacked Flaithbertach's children, they would have become martyrs, and certain northern clans could have taken up arms under that pretext. You, however, were not among my people, so nobody can associate me. You and the abbot of Finian just killing with some other malefactors. We have not seen one another many times. Now it is your name that is famous for killing the children of Flaithbertach.
So you refuse me? After all I've done?
I want more money, or I will talk to others about your involvement.
Traitor! Your hands remain clean while I will be hated by all the lords! (Intelligence)
Well, Morrigan is still alive.

I never promised you anything I haven't paid. This arrangement was important to Eriu. Now, at least, I help you leave this island. Here many will hate you for killing Flaithbertach's children. I don't abandon any who has served me well, no matter how mercenary. I could reward you with 50,000 peningas. This should help you in your new life far from here.
Well, I understand. I guess I can pay you for your silence. How about 100,000 peningas? This should help you in your new life far from here

You're smarter than you act. I cannot lie. This much is true: many a lord has put you on his list of enemies, but it was for the good of Eriu. However, I desire to give you enough gold for your exile from Eriu. Seventy thousand peningas should be sufficient to start a new life far from here.

Aah... I understand you're worried and will try to use anything to scare me. I know Morrigan is no longer a threat. You must leave Eriu as soon as possible, but this does not mean I not care about your welfare. I'll give you 30.000 peningas. This should be sufficient to start a new life far from here.
I guess I have no choice. I take your money and leave this island.
Give me the money; then see what I'll do.
You can keep your money. I want you to clear my name.

Alright. I do not have that amount here and now. I have a farm near Temair. I will see you there and pay as agreed. In fact, I will give a banquet in your honor, for we will not meet again after that. Farewell, {playername}.

I understand. Your reputation is most important for you. I agree, I will help you to clear your name, I have strong influence in Eriu. I will use it and all money that I was going to give you. I have to think of a plan. Meanwhile, we will do this: I have a farm near Temair. I will see you there. In fact, I will give a banquet in your honor while we talk about the way to clear your name. Farewell, {playername}.

I guess it is fair to recognize that you've exceeded all my expectations. You're much too dangerous to have as an enemy. I offer here and now peace between us. I'll pay you 50,000 peningas for all the harm I've caused you, and from this moment, our paths never cross again. You will not pursue me, and I won't send men to kill you. It will simply be as if we had never known one another. I promise before my mother, present here. Do you agree?
Well, we both are but businessmen. I accept your money. You will never again hear from me.
I agree, but exchange the money for favor with Ard Ruire Aed mac Niall of Aileach.
I think not. Blood is paid with blood. Today your days over.
No! My family demands revenge from their graves. This cannot end without blood!^^Remember me, Mael Bresail? Do you remember me, rat? I've come to kill you!
No! My family demands revenge from their graves. This cannot end without blood!^^Remember me, Mael Bresail? Do you remember me, rat? I've come to kill you!
Here's your money. If ever we meet again, I do not know you. Our business is done. No more fear; no more death. May gold seal our pact, and may God witness our oaths.

That seems fair. I shall speak highly of you to my king, and he will love you more than he loves his favorite vassal. If ever we meet again, I do not know you. Our business is done. No more fear; no more death. May God witness our oaths.
I swear. Our enmity is buried.
I swear before my mother. Go in peace. You are a rich man now.
I see you're a warrior unable to see for the glints from steel, so steel shall you receive. Here. Now. Of the two, only one will leave. Men, to me!
Do you remember me, rat? I have also come to kill you, to avenge my family!
It's time to meet with your Maker!
--His face shows terror--^^You? But... Kill them, kill them all!
Kill them, kill them all!
You look like a warrior. Are you looking for work?
I know who you are. They call you 'the Snake.' I was sent to kill you.
Snake, I'm not here to join your army, I fear.
Sure, Snake, how much you pay?
Why? Ah, I understand. I will not run away. This town has a field for local competitions. I'll wait there with my best men. Come and bring your most loyal companions. We will fight to the death.

Only my enemies call me 'the Snake.' I know I am a loose thread. I represent a danger to the interests of the Rat, your patron. Coward that he is, he does not dare to come himself but sends murderers. I will not run away. This town has a field for local competitions. I'll wait there with my best men. Come and bring your most loyal companions. We will fight to the death.

Only my enemies call me 'the Snake.' The same that destroyed my family. Do you come to kill me? I will not run away. This town has a field for local competitions. I'll wait there with my best men. Come and bring your most loyal companions. We will fight to the death.
Then we have an appointment.
Erm, just a moment.
No! You want my head, so at least have the courage to battle for it.^^[Your companions will join to you in this duel.]
Do you come to kill me, murderer? Your lord, Mael Bresail, would be happy to end my lineage.

{playername}, I want to thank you for all your help. Without you, I would never have avenged my family. Although the death of Mael Bresail has not given me any joy, I feel I've done the right thing. My family can now rest in peace. My travels with you are over. I leave you because I need to remove myself from the world I have known and find a place to live in peace, far away from Eriu. I need to leave behind my past to build a future, and that means leaving you.
It is your end, witch. I kill you now.
What are you talking about, witch?
Mael Bresail isn't my lord.

My father, Flaithbertach, could have been king, but he was killed by his own brother, Aed of Aileach, and your master, Mael Bresail. You plan to kill the last member from Flaithbertach's lineage. The gods and men curse your name.^^For some time now, I have owned nothing more than my life. Yet I do not fear death and think maybe it may remedy my torment.^^      (Before you can do anything, Morrigan casts herself on your weapon, inviting death. She utters no sound. You watch her eyes close and peace spread across her face.)
Then you kill without knowing your victim or why she should be killed, murderer?
Then why do you work for him and his damned lord, Aed of Aileach, and kill their enemies for them, murderer?

Bal Luighne? I could have destroyed that village long ago, but never attacked. I just terrorized the locals so that they would leave the place and leave this land to me. I only seek a place to live and feel protected, but the peasants are stubborn and Mael Bresail found out where I am. Then he sent you to kill me and finish off my lineage. You may have no idea, but your patron is implacable. Recently, he sent men to kill to my brother in Pictland and his sons -- just children -- near Caer Meguaidd. Now, I am last of my family. I see it was impossible to hide from Mael Bresail. I found this remote part of the world and forgot my name by taking that of the goddess, Morrigan. Yet here you are to kill me.
Liar! You are trying to confuse me. It's time to die.
Then that would make you... Flaithbertach's daughter? No wonder you are a menace!

My father, Flaithbertach, could have been king, but he was killed by his own brother, your master. This is Eriu. If you want the throne, you have to catch and eliminate all potential competitors. Fratricide is practically a way of life. Aed was faster to the deed than my father. Then, with the help of Mael Bresail, he killed my mother and the rest of my family. Just my brother, his sons, and I escaped, but Mael eventually found us. Now only I am alive, but even so, now at the tip of your sword.
Even so, you did too much damage to the people of Bal Luighne. You pay now with your life.
Mael Bresail used me? I am NOT his hired murderer!

Well, that's hardly my problem. I'm tired of fleeing. Everyone I cared for is dead. I just want to see them again and be at peace. Go back to your master and collect your reward, murderer. I do not begrudge you that.
Mael Bresail uses everybody. What do you want to do now?
You did too much damage to the people of Bal Luighne. You pay now with your life.
I will let you live, as I want answers from Mael Bresail. I will be back.
I'd rather go with you. You've killed my last supporter, and in any case, I do not want to try to hide anymore. I will join you, disguised as one of your warriors.
I understand. I hope you find the peace that you wish.
Morrigan, you cannot leave me. I need you.

Thank you for understanding me. It has not been an easy decision. In your army, I feel protected, but this life is not for me. I need a place to call home, where I can be happy. Maybe someday we will meet again, but I think not. I just want you to know that you have become a very important person to me. I wish you luck, {playername}. The gods allow you to get everything that you deserve. You are destined for greatness.

Do not make this difficult. My decision is made. This life is not for me. I need a place to call home, where I can be happy. Maybe someday we will meet again, but I think not. I just want you to know that you have become a very important person to me. I wish you luck, {playername}. The gods allow you to get everything that you deserve. You are destined for greatness.
Farewell, Morrigan. If you ever need me, I will come.
Farewell, Morrigan.
[You watch as Morrigan turns her back and walks away from you. She turns her face for an instant, and you think you see tears in her eyes. Then she leaves.]
--A tall man, his face marked by surprise, moves toward you.--^^What were those creatures? What happened here?
Addio.
And you are?
Thanks for your help!
Those things were Morrigan and his minions.
Eh? Oh, yes... My name is Aed mac Ainmerech, and the man who accompanies me is Olchobar mac Cinaeda of the Ui Neill.
That's me. We have been chosen to save Bal Luighne from the evil that has befallen it.
Our help? This is pure coincidence! We were returning to Bal Luighne when we saw something in the fog. We played the horns to signal that we had no hostile intentions.
Was that Morrigan? With the fog, I saw demons. I was sure old Caliacas' problem was a Viking war band...
You seem worried now, Aed, but a few hours ago you were telling me how you could defeat any creature!
This is no time for jokes, Olchobar.^^--He turns to you--^^And who are you, and what brings you to this godforsaken place?
Your performances are stellar, but unfortunately we must cut this entertainment short. If that's Morrigan, we have to follow her and find out where her lair is.
But Caliacas sent us a message to return to the village. Something bad must be happening...
This is more important. We should all follow Morrigan.
The village is more important. We should all return with haste.
We must part ways. You two go to the village, and I will follow Morrigan.
We must part ways. You two follow Morrigan, and I will go to Bal Luighne.
Ha! I see you were thinking up orders while dragging your feet!
Actually, we do know the area better. We will follow Morrigan. Meanwhile, find out what is happening to Caliacas in Bal Luighne.
Yes, somebody has to see what is happening to Caliacas in Bal Luighne. You go there while we follow Morrigan.
Very well. I will see you soon.
I do not agree with that plan.
Good luck. We will send a messenger as soon as we find Morrigan's lair.
Do I look worried about that? You were the last to arrive, so your mission is to hear and obey.

There is no need to be arrogant, Aed. Believe me, {playername}, this makes the most sense. We are from Eriu and won't waste time getting lost. We will send a messenger as soon as we find Morrigan's lair. Farewell.

{playername}! My messenger found you. Morrigan's beasts attacked us. They killed our men, and we're stuck here. Morrigan's camp is just ahead. You and your troops are our only hope. You have to get us out of here.
Addio.
Morrigan's beasts attacked me, too.
We must kill Morrigan together.
Then they caught you here, too. We must flee before they decide to return.
Are you crazy? Her beasts destroyed my men. Caliacas and his farmers left, looking for other heroes. I will not lose my life in this place.
Morrigan's camp is just ahead. We must kill her together. Follow me now!
I will kill Morrigan with or without you.
They'll finish you, stupid, Morrigan or her beasts. We will not go with you, but stay here and wait for the best time to escape.
No. We will not go with you. We'll stay right here and wait for the best time to escape. If you want so much to die, you will die alone.
Rat! Then I shall kill you.
Cowards! I will kill Morrigan by myself. Farewell.
Heill! Welcome! My name is Thora Ulfsdottir. I am the only daughter of Ulf. You should talk to him.
Sorry, I am busy.
Thora, nice to meet you. I will go and talk to your father. Farewell.
Thora, I'd rather talk to you than your father. You're a very pretty girl.
Thora, your name is pretty, as are you. I am Egil Horiksson. My weapons are sword and spear, but I yield to your beauty.
Why, thank you... sir. I blush at your compliments. You're also... very handsome.
(Allow them to continue talking and go talk to Ulf)
Egil, leave the girl alone, and let's go.
Damn, you cannot stand to see people happy, can you? All right, I will, {reg59?madam:sir}.
Why, thank you... sir. I blush at your compliments. You're also... very handsome.
Thank you, but you should talk to my father, Ulf.
(Use your powers of persuasion to make Thora interested in you)
You seem like such a smart girl. Tell me about yourself.
Well, then I will go to talk to your father. Farewell.
Better not. My father does not like me to talk to strangers. Please go talk to him.
(You see her eyes brighten as you tell her about your adventures. You approach her and put your hand over hers. It is not rejected. You try to kiss her, but she puts her hand on your mouth.)
Not here. My father will get angry. I will look for you tonight. Now, go see my father, Ulf.
I don't have time for you now.
{playername}, what are you doing here again?

{s2}^^{playername}, thank you very much for saving my life, my farm and my daughter, Thora. I want to reward you by giving you these treasures. Besides, these are the weapons of Orm Svarti. I think they should be yours.

Heill! My name is Ulf Thorirsson. My jarl, Sigurd Ragnarsson, notified me that you were coming. Welcome to my farm. You and your men can eat and sleep here until Sigurd's people arrive. The only thing I ask is that none of them comes close to my daughter, Thora.

Heill! My name is Ulf Thorirsson. My jarl, Sigurd Ragnarsson, sent me a warning that you were coming. Welcome to my farm. You and your men can eat and sleep here until Sigurd's people arrive. The only thing I ask is that none of them comes close to my daughter, Thora.
I am very busy now. My thralls are lazy.
Thank you, Ulf. I promise that no one will touch your daughter, and I appreciate your hospitality.
Enough about your daughter. Provide food and drink for my men, as hospitality dictates.
(Ulf gives some orders, and two servants step out of the main house with viands and drink. They give skvr -sour milk- and buttered bread to you and your men.)
It is all that I have, and I offered it with good will.
He's lying! I've seen barrels of beer and venison in a nearby warehouse. We are eating and drinking this shit while he is keeping the best for himself.

{s2}^^He is laughing at us. He's a rich man yet gives us the worst dining. He has neglected the laws of hospitality! He dies now! Nobody laughs at Egil, and he will serve as an example to others to respect us.
{s2}^^If you kill this man, you'll have to pay high compensation to his family, or perhaps they decide to seek revenge on yours. Is that what you want?
Do not kill him, then, but let's cut his sword hand. He does not deserve Walhalla!
Good food and drink has been offered. This is the home of Ulf, and we will follow his ways.
Nobody's going to die here. Eat and drink what our host offered you and be happy with it.
Egil and Reginhard are right. Ulf has broken the rules of hospitality, so off with his hand.
Bastard! Sigurd Ragnarsson will know about this!
{s2}^^That will be a pleasure!
What about the food and the beer?
Distribute the beer and food. Ulf has broken the standard of hospitality, so we will too.
No one will touch the food and beer. We are not thieves.
Bullshit! I will not drink their piss and eat their garbage. I do not care if Egil kills him or not. I'll go directly to Ulf's warehouse and take what I want.
{s2}^^Yes, good idea, Reginhard. I'll do the same. {playername} may stay with him and drink sour milk, if {reg59?she:he} wants.
(Let them go to the warehouse to drink and eat what they want.)
Reginhard and Egil, stay still where you are, or you will pay dearly.
Egil and Reginhard, when I make decisions, you follow them, got it? (Leadership)
{s2}^^Yes, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. We are at your service and will do as you command.
Distribute the beer and food. Ulf has broken the standard of hospitality, so we will too.
You threaten your friends to protect a rat like Ulf, who has laughed in our face. I will not fight against you, in memory of what we went through together, but I do not like your decision.
Good words, Reginhard. I also respect your decision, {playername}, but you should think how good you are with the men under your command...
Do not touch the stock. That food is not ours.
{s2}^^But that is my food and my drink... You're a thief and a robber.
It's not yours. This farm belongs to my men while we await the arrival of Sven Bull Neck.
Thanks, I'm sure that the gods will reward you. I will tell you one thing. Sven Bull Neck is not a man who easily submits, so keep your weapons close.
That's what I'll do. Now I go to station my men to wait until Sven Bull Neck appears.
Ulf, keep these spoils for Thora's future child, and tell him something about his father.
Ulf, keep this money and these items for Thora's future child. I will be content with this.
Ulf, keep this money for Thora's future child. I will be content to keep Orm's sword and mail.
Thanks, Ulf, your gifts are welcome.
Please be assured that your child will know who his father is, and I will always remember.
You are a generous man. I hope you leave the Assembly in good standing. My house is your house. Farewell.
May the Spinners of Fate be benevolent to you.

There is no doubt that your luck exceeds that of most other men. You, my friend, are destined either for greatness or to give greatness to whoever kills you. You've beaten a notorious berserker. You have my respect and admiration.
Ulf, I want to convince you not to testify against me in the Assembly.
I'm just passing through. Just wanted to say hello. Farewell.

I prefer to talk about my daughter. She's pregnant with your child, an illegitimate baby of a man without a future. You have dishonored my house and my daughter. I will present my case to the Assembly.

I prefer to talk about my daughter. She's pregnant with the illegitimate child of your companion, Egil, a man without a future. You have dishonored my house and my daughter. I will present my case to the Assembly.

I prefer to talk about my daughter. She's pregnant with the illegitimate child of one of your men, who raped her in the night after drinking too much mead. You have dishonored my house and my daughter. I will present my case to the Assembly.
Sorry, I had no idea. I will marry her.
Sorry, I had no idea. Egil will marry her.
This is terrible. The man that you choose from my party will marry her.
I understand. I'll take your daughter with me.
It was an unfortunate incident. Let us agree on wergild in compensation.
Are you sure this child is not simply that of one of your thralls?
Marry you? My daughter? No, you are lower class than she, and besides, you'll soon be dead. Everybody knows that Sigurd Ragnarsson will ask for your head at the Assembly.
With any of your men? Perhaps you think she's a whore. Say something sensible or clear out of here.
This is a joke, no? Thora cannot go with you. She is my only daughter. She is too important to be left in your hands.
Father, calm down. I'm sure {playername} has spoken without thinking. {reg59?She:He} knows I am a virtuous woman not given to anyone.
{playername}, you should apologize to this man. Remember that you need him to be happy to avoid his testifying against you at the Assembly.
{s2}^^I will act as if I didn't hear this.
{s2}^^This conversation is over. I will be happy when Sigurd Ragnarsson kills you after the Assembly. Now, get out of my farm.
Ulf, if you testify against me at the Assembly, I will kill you, Thora, and burn your farm to the ground. Got it? (Sanguine).
Calm down man! There is no need to humiliate this man so much.
Hey! I am right here. Marry? I will never marry. Thora should be proud to have a child with royal blood in her belly.
Egil is an inveterate womanizer. He is fickle, usually drunk and futureless. Would you marry your daughter to him?
Si.
No.
Who? Brunhild here? She is not my daughter.
Well, you are quite the dolt. Thora is the daughter of a wealthy man, while Egil is but a bastard. You're insulting me.
Well, I do not quite know whether to be flattered or offended. I will act as if I have not heard your words.
Nobody wants Egil in the family. Moreover, Thora is the daughter of a wealthy man, while Egil is but a bastard.
I understand. I'll take your daughter with me.
It was an unfortunate incident. Let us agree on wergild in compensation.
Are you sure this child is not by one of your thralls?

The law in Danmark makes a distinction between if she was raped or voluntarily surrendered. It is also important to note the differences in status. Anyway, if you want to avoid further problems and leave this man satisfied, give him 4000 peningas, and he will deliver all his daughters to sleep with you.^^{s2}
Do not listen to silly Egil, {reg59?lady:sir}, but it's true that with 4000 peningas, Ulf will be more than happy and will not testify against you.
Oh, money! My favorite topic. This is where I come in.
{s2}^^Look at this man! He must be more than two meters if he's an inch!
And who are you?
He is a...

He is Orm the Black, guest of Ulf Thorinsson and future owner of his farm and daughter. I am not in the habit of eavesdropping, but since everything related to this farmstead is now my business, I've decided to introduce myself and act.
So... Orm. How is it that you are the future owner of this farm?
I do not care who you are. This is a private matter. Go away.
Oh, I don't think so. This farm and the girl pregnant because of you will be my property tomorrow, so you will negotiate with me and not with this old fool.

{playername}, my father has his pride, but we need your support. Orm Svarti is a berserk and a duelist. He is an evil person, but no one can stand up to him. He arrived shortly after you left us and asked for my hand, which my father withheld. Then he challenged my father to a duel to the death. Orm will kill my father and then stay with me on the farm. My father is old and cannot deal with this man. Please be our second.

{s2}^^This man is scum, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. He challenges old defenseless peasants in order to steal everything they have. Worst of all, he wants to make Ulf's daughter a slave... and who knows what will happen to the child in Thora's belly.

Ignore them. You're lucky I'm here. Ulf will not testify against you in the Assembly on account of his death, and the girl will not be your problem because I will take care of her and the rat within. And since I like you, I'll give you half price. All you have to do is give me 2000 peningas. What do you say?
It's a deal, Orm. Take this money, and thanks for taking care of this matter.
Ulf will be dead tomorrow, so my problem is solved. Why pay you a single pening?
I will pay wergild of 4000 peningas to Ulf now, and the case is closed.
No, I'm afraid not. I hate injustice and must settle my debt. I will fight on Ulf's behalf.
No. The two matters are separate. I will both pay my wergild of 4000 peningas and fight.

Well, well. A farm, a pretty girl and 2000 peningas to boot. The gods have always loved me. Good travels and good luck so that, someday, in the unlikely event that you ever make anything of yourself, we may meet again.
Oh, well, right you are. Then get off my farm. Good travels and good luck so that, someday, in the unlikely event that you ever make anything of yourself, we may meet again.

Well, his money is my money. If you are such an idiot, the better for me. A farm, a pretty girl and 4000 peningas to boot. The gods have always loved me. Good travel and good luck so that, someday, in the unlikely event that you ever make anything of yourself, we may meet again.
{reg59?My lady:My lord}, are you sure? Have you considered your relative height and your old wounds? This man is made for murder!
No, worse, he's a berserker. If he enters his trance, {playername}, you won't have a chance.
Ha! No way to back out now! A word spoken is a word that cannot be returned!
The gods bless you, {playername}. We will always be indebted to you.

I did not expect this selfless reaction. I know that I do not stand a chance against Orm Svarti, so I'm very grateful. Whatever happens, know that I will not testify against you at the Assembly. Ragnarsson will not like that much, but it's you that are here for me. What's more, I won't ask wergild for my daughter. What you do makes up for any debt between us. Thank you. We are now at peace.

If you are such an idiot, the better for me. Such heroes always end up occupying but six square feet of earth. If you so desire such a plot, your time has come. I am only too happy to add all of your things to the farm and the girl.
Gods curse you, {playername}. You've effectively sentenced my father to death and me to slavery.
Gentle, Thora, my daughter. This piece of scit is not worth a curse.
This is not right...
It is, if you do not want to die. {playername} does well. Let's go, we're done here.
Ic grete thee, {playername}. What you need?
I want to load some things on the horses.
Nothing. Farewell.
Always at your service.
Si?
Pater, I will donate 500 peningas to aid the families of my fallen men.
Nothing. Farewell.
Ego absolvo te a peccatis tuis, in nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sanctii. Amen. Your men will feel better now.
Si?
Priest, my men need Odin. I will donate 500 peningas for your aid in this matter.
Priest, my men need you. Will you join my shield wall?
Is there anything I can do to help this hof?
Perhaps. We are having a feast soon, to honor goddess Saga, and we are running low on some essential supplies. Would you be able to bring us {reg33} drinking horns of mead?
No, my son, we don't need your help at the moment.
You can count on me.
Priest, I brought you {reg33} drinking horns of mead, as you requested.
Thank you, {playername}. Saga will be proud of {s3} and your efforts. May she guide you in battles.
Priest, I don't believe I have time for this.
Nothing. Farewell.
Well, I'll pack my things and join you.
I will talk to your men about Odin, Thor and Freya. It will encourage them to fight proudly by your side, to earn their seats at Walhalla.
Greetings. What can I do for you?
Nient'altro?
Cook, I have a job for you! My men deserve a feast.
That'll be all.
I estimate the cost of the feast to be 1000 peningas.
Go ahead. Take the money and prepare it all.
Hmm, let me think more about this.
So shall it be done! I'll get the necessary money from your coffers, buy ingredients for my finest dishes, and hire staff to make it a memorable night!
Sorry, sir, but your coffers are empty. We will need more money for the banquet.
{s2}^^Hello, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. How can I serve you?
I am at your service, {playername}.
I need to raise the spirits of my men.
I do not want anything for my men. I would like your company.
I need nothing. Farewell.

Well, your men will have the mead hall at their disposal. They can eat and drink all they want and I'll get some girls to keep them company. I assure you they will be happy after this party. It will cost you 1500 coins.
Your men will have fun as ever. I'll get the prettiest girls, the best drinks and the best food. I assure you their moral will be sky high after this party. It will cost you 1700 coins.
Well, I suppose my men have earned it. This time.
Well, I suppose my men have earned it. This time.
Alas, my lady, my purse weighs not enough for all your considerable charm. Farewell!
I'm pleased, my {reg59?lady:lord}. So you like me. Well, for you, there is a special price of only 100 coins, as a token of our 'friendship'...
Great, here, take these coins as a 'gift.'
No thanks. Why help you steal from me?

(Time passes, and you forget the rigors and fatigue from the journey that lingered upon your body and soul. For a few hours, your armor and sword, the fear of dying in any skirmish, the punishment of the rain and wind, and the dust of the roads are relegated to a small piece of happiness. Finally, it ends swiftly as your friend quietly leaves your room.)
Ave, my {reg59?lady:lord}. What do you need?
I am at your service.
I need you to cut my beard.
I need you to dress my light wounds.
You have some light wounds. I will cure them, but I charge {reg1} peningas for my work.
Here are your {reg1} peningas. Now cure my wounds.
Non ho abbastanza denaro.
I shall do as you ask, {reg59?madame:sir}. Fetch oil and wine!
I need you to tend to my heavy wounds.
I have no need of your services. Farewell.
You have serious injuries. I will cure them, but I charge {reg1} peningas for my work.
Here are your {reg1} peningas. Now cure my wounds.
Non ho abbastanza denaro.
I shall do my best, {reg59?madame:sir}. Fetch a hot iron and pliers!
Ave, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I am your skald. I can recite you a poem, or I can compose songs and poems about your honor and valour.
Ave, {reg59?my lady:my lord}. I am your bard. I can recite you a poem, or I can compose songs and poems about your honor and valour.
My art and skill will not disappoint you, my lord. What else do you need?
I want you to sing about me. I need to be known and famous.

{s2}^^I will write a poem so epic that all the isles will know about the greatness of {playername}. However, I must ask for a small sum to cover the cost of inks and... other things. I will need 500 coins.
Take the money. It is nothing to a mighty hero like me.
You ask the same price as a happy widow, and I could make her sing better! No, thank you.
Can you sing for me and my men?
A bard? Songs? Why don't you go out and earn your bread like the rest of us? Farewell.
It will cost you 100 coins. I can sing...
Cantiga 2
Never mind. I want to ask you something else.
How may I help you, Commander?
Anything else, Commander?
Is there anything I should know?
Captain, I want to improve this place.
Captain, how will the improvement work?
Captain, I want to improve this hideout.
I would like to land my ships here next to this refuge.
We will need 1,000 peningas, to pay staff and buy materials in order to build the jetties.
The Refuge is too far away from the shore. We can't do this.
Do so. Here is the money.
Ho cambiato idea.
Non ho abbastanza denaro.
Very well. It won't take long to build the jetties. You will be able to disembark here soon.
I will donate 500 peningas to the families of my men.
That'll be all.

Currently, we have a simple and poorly defended permanent camp with few services and capacity for fifty men. I suggest building some houses for the men stationed here, for them to bring their families, a mead hall to help them relax and improve morale, and a training camp for our men to improve their skills. It would be important to improve the defenses further. Finally, you will need more space. I would guess you would like to have a big and comfortable house.^^I estimate that we will need a lot of money, about 5,000 peningas, to pay staff and buy materials. In addition, we need you to buy us five tool kits and five timber pallets.
Well, go ahead. This site needs improvement, and I have the needed resources and money.
I will get what you asked for, and I will return with it later.
I'll think about it.
I'll put the men to work right now, commander. If all goes well, the work will be finished in a week.
Commander, how can I say this? You do not have enough money. We need 5,000 peningas.
The workers are working hard, commander.
Nothing right now.

Currently, we have a nice hideout with a mead hall and capacity for 120 men. I suggest building more houses for the men stationed here and for their families. On the other hand, we could use a blacksmith to help to repair our weapons and armor and build a stable for our horses. Moreover, it would be important to improve the defenses further with earthen mounds and ditches. Finally, you will need more space. I would guess you would like to have a mead hall, as befits a warlord.^^I estimate that we will need a lot of money, about 10,000 peningas, to pay staff and buy materials. In addition, we need you to buy us five tool kits and five timber pallets.
Well, go ahead. This site needs improvement, and I have the needed resources and money, too.
I will get what you ask, and will return with it later.
I'll think about it.
I'll put the men to work right now, commander. If all goes well, the work will be finished in two weeks.
Commander, how can I say this? You do not have enough money. We need 10,000 peningas.
Thank you, {reg59?my lady:sir}. This will raise the morale and loyalty of the men.
{reg59?Madame:Sir}, surely you do not remember me. My face looks much different when it's not being tortured. I am the man you questioned in Doccinga after the battle, Olafr the Captain.

The truth is that, after my defeat, Sven disowned me, and I've been without a lord ever since. I served as a mercenary but had bad luck -- I spent everything I was paid on mead and women. I was looking for you, because you are the only person who showed compassion for me in the hardest times. I want to serve you, to fight in your army. I will be faithful if you accept me.
Veterans like you are always welcome.
No, surely you are a spy. Be gone.
Thank you. I will be the bravest and the most loyal of your men!
I understand and accept your rejection. You will not see me again.
{s2}^^Damn, Olvir White Hair, perhaps you thought you could beat us? I had heard that you're a smart man.
{s2}^^My life and my death serve the purposes of my lord. My victory would have been over an enemy that he hates. My death will make you banned before the Assembly, {playername}.
What does he mean about the Assembly, Egil?
I do not care about your lord. Where is your brother, Olvir?
Sigurd is making a lot of trouble for me. It's time he pays for his treachery.

{s2}^^You will be accused of having killed Olvir before the Assembly, the assembly of free men, and they will demand payment or revenge. As Sigurd already wants you dead, it is clear that they will kill you.
{s2}^^Do not worry, he will find you. You will regret having pursued him, and have caused many evils for Sigurd Ragnarsson. You've annoyed the wrong people, {playername}.

{s2}^^You fool! I will laugh at you when Sigurd Ragnarsson kills you as I enjoy feasts at Walhalla. You have no idea who Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' is and what he is capable of. Everyone fears him, even his own brothers... well, maybe not Ivar the Boneless. Ivar is the most ruthless of the sons of Ragnar.
{s2}^^I'm dying... Give me my sword, so that the Valkyries will see that I am a warrior and take me to the halls of Odin.
{playername}, this man has insulted and threatened you, and tried to kill us. He is not deserving of our compassion. Also, giving the sword is a pagan custom. Let him die and go to hell.
Egil, give him his sword. It allows him to travel to Walhalla.
No, he's right. You do not deserve Walhalla, Olvir. Egil, give me the sword.

{s2}^^Banquets, women and endless battles await you in the hall of the gods, Olvir. You've been good warrior, although we have been enemies. I will see you someday, and maybe we can fight alongside each other at Ragnarok.
{reg59?Madame:Sir}, this man fought well, let him go to Walhalla.
Please...
Well, Egil, give him his sword.
No. Egil, give me his sword, for it will be mine. Let him go to hell.

{reg59?Madame:Sir}, it is time to hit the road. We should go talk to my father, King Horik. Being charged with murder before the Assembly is a very serious thing, and Sigurd will seek to exploit this advantage to the fullest.
Let us not waste more time but go.
We're just here to prevent escapes. Good luck.
All yours! I already hit him pretty hard.
Thor, we have a new visitor. Our friend hit me hard. Come and see if you can better him?
This is getting boring. Don't you have better things to do?
Well?
I'll ask you some questions, and, if you answer right, you won't have to keep suffering.
--You give drinking water to the prisoner.--
--You clean the prisoner's wounds.--
You need not suffer any more. We are not enemies. We can talk like people.
Now, let me ask a few questions, and you're going to answer.
--You hit the prisoner's face.--
--You hit the side of the prisoner, where it hurts.--
Now, let's talk! --You hit the side of the prisoner again and then his face.--
No one will come back for you. Answer me, and I'll help you get home. (Persuasion)
I am your prisoner, and I'm alone in your hands, but my boss will not forget me. Sven Bull Neck never abandons his men. I'll answer what you ask, but only if it doesn't affect my master or his cause.
I promise to release you and give you 1000 coins if you answer my questions. (Persuasion)
Your words seem sincere, and I like your offer. I'm not ready yet to visit Walhalla. Ask, and I will answer.
Maybe this will motivate you --You grab his crotch and squeeze hard-- (Power Strike)
Do you prefer pain? --You grab his hand and break his fingers one by one-- (Power Strike)
--You take a bread knife and cut the skin on his arms into strips.-- (Power Strike)
Please, Thonkrik, can you help me get some answers?

{s2}^^Listen, Olafr. You attacked our village and killed our people. There are widows and orphans out there because of you, but we are ready to set you free if you answer {playername}'s questions.^This is the choice we give you: yield a few words or die here without your sword. I am your only friend here, but if you do not say what we want to hear, I will leave you in the hands of these animals.
Torturer, the prisoner wants to be hit. Please accommodate him.
I don't have any more questions for now.
{s2}^^Sure, the pleasure is mine. Please, {playername}, get back. I need space, and I do not want you splattered with blood. Come back when you want me to stop hitting him.
{s2}^^Please, please, enough already of abuse. I am sure you will be able to obtain the information by other means.
I told you all I know.
Why did you attack Doccinga?
Sven Bull Neck was not with you. Where is he?
Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' Ragnarsson is a name I have heard recently. Is he your Lord?
Tell me about Ragnar and his sons.
Olafr, were you in the attack on a merchant ship called the Woden Ric?
No more questions.
I know nothing!
I say nothing!
Why did you attack the ship? They were only travelers and traders!
Listen, this is very important. Did anyone survive your attack?
My mother was on that ship.
Where did the prisoners go?
Well, we spared some men, even a madwoman who talked nonsense. Maybe your mother is among them.

Sven Bull Neck took them with him. He was going to leave them in his hideout before continuing his journey north. The hideout is in Danmark. It is a good place and well defended, but I will not tell you where it is. I will not betray my masters just so you can kill me.

{s3}^^There is no need to torture him for that information. There is a man in the port of Ribe who deals with the Vikings for their slaves. He is a Frisian from Doccinga who has thrived in Ribe as port master. One often finds him outside, by the docks. He is not a good person, but he will sell whatever information you may require. When you talk to him, please do not mention my name, because it was I who forced him to leave Doccinga some years ago.
I have nothing to add.
Awaiting orders.
I do not have time for you. Farewell.

Heill, captains! I have sent for you because tomorrow at noon we will reach the coasts of Northhymbre. It is time to release the details of the mission and talk about the problems that plague this fleet.

The men are strong, with healthy teeth and hard muscles. The women are healthy, but they are sisters. They are the last slaves I have, so they go together in the package, or nothing. However, I'll give you a discount, and they will cost you only 900 peningas.
Who are you, and what do you want?
Heill, {playername}! Heill, Egil, vinr! We received your message and we are here. We hope we are in time to come to the party.
Gods protect us!
Sure, Harald! We're still waiting for the men of Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye.' My friend, here, is eager to meet Sven Bull Neck.
Welcome, Harald. We appreciate the help of King Horik.

I'm sure of it. Until the time comes, I will keep my men hidden, ready to intervene if things get ugly. The king was very clear, {playername}. You must not begin hostilities. In fact, he wants you to avoid confrontation if at all possible.
It will not be me who starts this battle. I promise.
Sven Bull Neck did me much evil. I promise nothing.
The king is a man who likes his wishes to be executed. Now we enter the farm. My men are hungry and thirsty.
I am especially interested in this meeting. I have long been waiting to hear from my mother.
(Say nothing)
I think you may be wondering what our guest may have to say about this, but first we go to the most urgent matter.

In Northhymbre, our Danish brothers have become strong. They control the kingdom through a puppet king. There are small uprisings of Angles, but these are localized and severely repressed. Nothing serious. The latest news we have is that the sons of Ragnar have moved south and taken a place, known as Snotingaham, in Mierce. The king of Mierce has not taken this well. He has besieged them there with his army, supported by the king of West Seaxe. We fear that the Ragnarssons may be in a hard place, so our mission is to go to Jorvik and join the forces that are gathering under Rathbarth, another of the sons of Ragnar, in support of his brothers. From there we will move south to meet the Angles and Saxons. With a little luck, we will kill their kings and the road south will be opened for plunder. You will come back rich to your wife and kids this year.
I hope so. I have too many mouths to feed!
{s2}^^You should have thought of that before having three wives and twenty children!
I'm sure that he has as many bastards among his servants!
The issue is serious. How many men do Mierce and West Seaxe have?
Sounds like a good plan, Harald. My men will go in the front!
I agree.

That is hard to say. The information we have comes from merchants and travelers. They speak of thousands of men. It hardly matters, though. The Angles and the Saxons are weak people, fully domesticated by their kings. It will be like attacking housewives.
{s2}^^Well, well. We have here an authentic toady. It seems there is always someone who is willing to stoop to any depth to gain favor with the boss.
I cannot stand sycophants, {playername}. Now let's move on to the serious stuff.

{s2}^^Although everything is clear and our goal is near, it seems that problems with Sven Bull Neck don't stop cropping up. This captain, Oleif, is now with us, and he has very serious news. Go ahead, Oleif.

{s2}^^I will not beat around the bush. Sven Bull Neck is unwilling to share command with Harald Haraldsson. At first opportunity, he will kill Harald and take the command. It may occur as we land, though I cannot be sure. Maybe my desertion of his party will change his mind.
I am making a guard rotation during the trip. When we land, I will challenge Sven to a duel to the death. Sven Bull Neck is a lunatic, but he's a dangerous lunatic.
Sounds good. You have my full support, even if you decide to attack his boat while he is still unprepared.
You have my support too, Harald. That man, Sven, is very dangerous.
I've been waiting long enough! What about my mother?
You have my support, but I'd like to ask about my mother.
I think Sven Bull Neck would make a better commander of this fleet than you.
I see. May you be a slave to Sven Bull Neck like your mother. I despise you, {playername}, and you give me shame, but the Assembly forced us to work together. I will tell you as you have not heard.

A woman travels with Sven Bull Neck. She is his seidr, one who accepts the spirit of the crow and speaks the words of Odin. Everybody reveres her, as she is a woman touched by the gods. Sven Bull Neck has married her in hopes of having a child touched by the gods, but she is old and her belly is dry. If she's your mother, I do not think she remembers you, as she has a curse that does not allow her to keep memories overnight.
It looks like your mother now serves Sven Bull Neck. I hope you're prepared to deal with this when things get ugly.
--All around you, the sudden tumult and shouting of men drowns out your answer. A warrior bursts into the meeting. He is hot, and his eyes show panic.--
Hersir Harald, sir! Sven Bull Neck has attacked us! Half the fleet is charging us! Thor help us, Sven has caught us unprepared.

{s3}^^Captains, return to your ships and lead your crew. Sven Bull Neck will pay dearly for this attack. If we should lose this battle, remember to inform Rathbarth Ragnarsson about this betrayal by Sven Bull Neck. Good luck. Now, to battle!

{playername}! My lord advised me that you'd come. Sven Bull Neck has taken Readingum and has many men with him, mainly Danish, who have sworn allegiance. They are tough, battle-hardened people, same as Sven, who is a legend. I would not like to be in the shoes of you or your men.
I am not afraid. It is the time of reckoning.
Do you know if a woman is with him?
Will you not stay and fight with us?

You mean your mother, the seidr, right? Yes, she is with them. We saw her when she entered Readingum with Sven Bull Neck. I do not know how she was before, but now she is very gaunt and thin. I do not think she has long to live.
I'm afraid not. My duties call me elsewhere. My role here was to make sure Sven Bull Neck would be here when you arrived. Apparently, my lord promised you this. He never breaks his word.

Well, from what I've heard, you also are someone dangerous. I will leave the half a hundred men I promised my lord I would. They are brave warriors who have been promised a lot of gold to help you, so fight well. Farewell, {playername}, and good luck!
I do not have time for you. Farewell.
I do not have time for you. Farewell.
I'm {playername}. I hear you have prisoners for sale.
I'm {playername}, but that's irrelevant, fool, because now we're going to kill you all!
Goodness! I am lost! My apologies, I am leaving now.
Get out of here, trash! Never show your ugly face again, or you will pay dearly!
Yet another slave merchant? I see. Well, I have a few slaves left.
I would like to see these slaves.
{playername}, to pay these men is to encourage them to keep attacking and enslaving people. We should make them pay dearly for the damage they do to people, not reward them for it!
Keep your mouth shut! I would like to see these slaves.
You are right. We're going to kill you all!
Well, I have three slaves. They're inside, down by the river. Go ahead and look at them, then come back to me to talk about buying them.
Sounds good! I'll look over the merchandise, and then we will talk money.
I understand. I'll take the three prisoners. Take your peningas. (900 peningas)
Look at them! Your men have starved and raped them. I'll pay 300 coin for the lot. (Trade)
They're in bad shape. Give them to me, and you won't have to feed them any more, deal? (Trade)
I don't have that kind of money. Farewell.
I've thought about it and I am not buying them. I'm leaving.
I need more time. Let me look at them again.
Deal! The merchandise is yours. A good visit!
I see, I see. Well, I suppose you're right. The merchandise is yours. Take the stinkers away. Far thu vel.
Greetings, {reg59?madame:sir}. Thank you for your help.
I read the document. It seems too new. I want to know the truth.
I'd like to listen to your story.
I want your version, but remember that I will kill the person who lies here.
I don't have any more questions.
{s2}^^I know nothing! I inherited the land of my ancestors. I don't have documents to prove it because it has never been necessary to prove that it was mine.
I know nothing! I inherited the land of my ancestors. I don't have documents to prove it because it has never been necessary to prove that it was mine.
Are you a liar?
I think you are lying to me.
I see. I understand.
God bless you. I am the monk who found the document.
God bless you.
I read the document. Everything seems to be right, but it is too well preserved.
I would like to listen to your story.
I want your version, but remember that I will kill the person who lies here.
I don't have any more questions.
{s2}^^I'm just a scribe in the monastery! I copy the ancient Roman texts. While looking for an old useless parchment to scrape and prepare for another document, I found this.
I'm just a scribe in the monastery! I copy the ancient Roman texts. While looking for an old useless parchment to scrape and prepare for another document, I found this.
You are a liar! This document is false! We don't have to talk more. Farewell, bastard.
I think you are lying to me.
Ok. I understand.
I am busy, talk to the Abbot.
Very well, my good man. Farewell.
I am busy, talk to the Abbot.
Very well, my good man. Farewell.
I've decided that you join our followers' party.
Very well, I will support you from the rear.
Pater, I will donate 500 peningas to aid the families of my fallen men.
Ego absolvo te a peccatis tuis, in nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sanctii. Amen. Your men will feel better now.
Priest, my men need Odin. I will donate 500 peningas to you for your aid in this matter.
I will talk to your men about Odin, relentless Thor, and Freyja, the hope of the slain. It will encourage them to fight proudly by your side, to earn their seats at Valhalla or Folkvangr.
Heill, what can you do in battle?

Me? - He approaches and whispers in your ear. - We are very useful. I am important for you. When your men see me in battle, they will gain courage. If things go wrong, they will fight longer before fear seizes them.
Me? - He approaches and whispers in your ear. - I am important for you. When your men see me in battle, they will gain courage. If things go wrong, they will fight longer before fear seizes them.
Heill, what can you do for my men?
Me?  I am important to you. I am the wife of one of your soldiers. If you have wives (30) in your party, your men will gain morale (every 48 hours).
I need you help me to raise the morale of my men. I pay 450 peningas for your efforts.
Men? Oh... well, it is important to help.
My {reg59?lady:lord}, we're only poor clerics trying to bring some light to the people of this land.
Christian cleric, eh? It's time to reunite you with your Creator!
Pater, I will donate 500 peningas to the families of my fallen men for your aid.
Ego absolvo te a peccatis tuis, in nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sanctii. Amen. Your men will feel better now.
And I'm only a poor hero on an important mission. Farewell.
Thank you. Farewell.
Odin is our God! He guides our way. Warrior, what do you need?
Pagan priest? You are scum of the false gods. Die!
Priest, my men need Odin. I will donate 500 peningas to for your aid in this matter.
I will talk to your men about Odin and his son Thor. That will encourage them to fight proudly by your side, to earn their seats at Walhalla.
I need to complete an important mission. Pass on.
Thank you. Farewell.
I heard that you are a famous strategist.

That's right! Thanks to God, I am the best commander in Europe. My name has been long known and famous in all of Englaland, dog. I am a champion of West Seaxe. I have single-handedly killed twenty men in the chaos of war, and I have won over twenty battles since I started leading shield walls.
I've never, ever, suffered a defeat. You wish to learn from me, right? Then be good and listen to my words carefully tonight, or I will send one of my men to cut your throat with his seax.
Yes, I'm interested.
No thanks. I have other matters to attend to.
I have good men, my beadupreat. They are ugly, stupid and cowardly, but they obey orders well. The first thing you need is men that obey orders without thinking too much.

Then, you must teach them to advance in column. When they march this way, you travel the countryside without losing anybody. In battle, you must teach them to form ranks (by pressing F4 and F4) or squares (by pressing F4 and F7). It is easy to implement formations if you have a handy stick to beat the clumsy animal who may be unable to fit in properly.

It is important that you know how to motivate your troops in battle. You can shout your barbaric war cry (by pressing the key T), which will undoubtedly scare away enemies surrounding you. You can always order your men to break the current formation (by pressing F4 and F8) so that they can properly charge into the enemy's lines.
Mm, I see. Please continue.
Stop. I don't need to hear more. Wes gesund.

Anyway, in my opinion ranks are crap better left to the dirty Welsh. If you really want to win a battle, pay attention! You must use Scildweall (by pressing F4 and F5) which forces your men to form a shield wall. We learned this tactic from the Romans, and a shield wall is a very cohesive tactic for our land. This formation is great, a true battle winner, and you should learn it well, dog. Scildweall will allow you to win your battles, fighting shoulder to shoulder with your men. You need to train it until you have sore knees and hands calloused by the use of the spear and shield. Get off your horse if you have one, and join your men, leading by example. When the enemy is broken and is fleeing, call your horse if it is still alive (by pressing h), mount it and charge the cowards, killing as many as you can to instill fear in your future enemies. You can also try to use the Wecg formation (by pressing F4 and F6) which will bring your men into forming a wedge shaped fighting body.

Hear me. This formation is difficult to master, so you should use it only with veteran troops. It is designed to break an enemy's Scildweall, but when you use it, you must know that you are playing for all or nothing. It is a risky bet, for, if you fail, your enemies will earn your flank and kill your men as if they were nothing more than dry grass. My personal advice is to use Scildweall against Scildweall, always. No need to take risks, I say. You can give weapon orders, too, (by pressing F5 key) or the order to skirmish (by pressing F6). That is all, dog. Learn soon, and quickly, because if one day we are in the battlefield as enemies, I will kill you. Wes gesund.
Thank you, Lord. I have learned so much.
Bah, someday I'll kill you. Farewell.

Hah! Our little plot against {s3} worked perfectly, {playername}. The fool has lost one of his most valuable retainers, and we are one step closer to bringing him to his knees. Here, this purse contains {reg5} peningas, and I wish you to have it. You deserve every bit. There could be much more to come, need I remind you, if you've a mind to earn it...

You weren't able to complete a simple task. I had set up everything. The only thing you needed to do was sacrifice a messenger, and we would be celebrating now. But no. You were too damned honorable, weren't you?
Mi avete portato delle nuove notizie sul compito che vi ho assegnato? Sapete che voglio dire...
Ho qui i rapporti che volevate.
Ahh, well done. It's good to have competent {reg59?people:men} on my side. Here is the payment I promised you.

Lavoro brillante, {playername}! Dopo quello che avete fatto, i nobili del {s13} chiedono a gran voce la guerra! Ora è giunto il momento di mietere il raccolto delle nostre azioni, e con questo intendo che dobbiamo prendere a saccheggiare i feudi nemici. Questa guerra ci renderà ricchi, ricordate le mie parole!

You incompetent buffoon! What in Hell made you think that getting yourself captured while trying to start a war was a good idea? These plans took months to prepare, and now everything's been ruined! I will not forget this, {playername}. Oh, be assured that I will not.

I'm told that you've collected the money owed me from {s7}. Good, it's past time I had it back. I believe I promised to give you one-fifth of it all, eh? Well, that makes {reg3} peningas, so if you give me my share -- that's {reg4} peningas -- you can keep the rest.
Of course, {s65}. {reg4} peningas, all here.
Devo ammettere di essere impressionato, {playername}. Avevo completamente perso la speranza di ricevere questo denaro. Accettate per favore i miei ringraziamenti.
I am afraid I don't have the money with me, sir.

Is this a joke? I know full well that {s7} gave you the money, and I want every pening owed to me, {reg59?madam:sir}. As far as I'm concerned, I hold you personally in my debt until I see that silver.

I heard you got rid of that poxy merchant that was causing me so much grief. I can see you're not afraid to get your hands dirty, eh? I like that in a {reg59?woman:man}. Here's your reward. Remember, {playername}, stick with me and we'll go a long, long way together.

Oh, it's you. Enlighten me, how exactly does one lose a simple fight to some poxy, lowborn merchant? Truly, if I ever need my guardsmen to take a lesson in how to lie down and die, I'll be sure to come to you. Just leave me be, {playername}, I have things to do.
You! Do you have sawdust between your ears? Did you think that when I said to kill the merchant, I meant you to have a nice chat with him and then let him go? What possessed you?
signore, mi sono assicurato che non agisca più contro i vostri interessi.

Piffle. You were supposed to remove him, not give him a sermon and send him on his way. He had better do as you say, or you'll both regret it. Here, this is half the money I promised you. Don't say a word, {playername}. You're lucky to get even that. I have little use for {reg59?people:men} who cannot follow orders.

Beautiful work, {playername}! You captured both the spy and his handler, just as I'd hoped, and the two are now safely ensconced in my dungeon, waiting to be questioned. My torturer shall be busy tonight! Anyway, I'm very pleased with your success, {playername}, and I give you this purse as a token of my appreciation.

Blast and damn you! I wanted TWO prisoners, {playername} -- what you've brought me is one step short of useless! I already know everything the spy knows. It was the handler I was after. Here, half a job gets you half a reward. Take it and begone.

Vi ho richiesto due prigionieri, {playername}, non uno. Due. Eppure, pare che abbiate catturato l'addestratore della spia, il più importante della coppia. La spia non rischierà di tornare qui e si dimostrerà abbastanza inutile per qualunque maestro essa abbia servito. Questo è meglio di niente. Comunque, mi comprenderete se vi pago la metà di quanto promesso per questo mezzo successo.

In realtà, {playername}, non avete mostrato altro che una totale incompetenza. Mancando di catturare la spia e il suo addestratore cadete in nuove e stupefacenti profondità di fallimento. Dimenticate ogni ricompensa che vi ho offerto. Non avete fatto niente per guadagnarla.
Ho fatto del mio meglio, {s65}.
Grazie, {s65}.
Hm. Come volete, {s65}.
Splendido lavoro, {playername}. Tutti i servi in fuga sono tornati e si stanno preparando per il raccolto. Avete certamente guadagnato la vostra paga. Ecco, prendete, con i miei complimenti.

{playername}. I have been waiting patiently for my serfs, yet none has returned. Have you an explanation? Were you outwitted by simple field hands, or are you merely incompetent? Or perhaps you are plotting with my enemies, intending to ruin me...
Forgive me, {s65}. Those serfs were as slippery as eels.
Forse se li aveste trattati meglio...
Humph. That is hardly an excuse for failure, {playername}. Now if you will excuse me, I need to recruit new men to work these fields before we all starve.
Hah, ora rivelate di che pasta siete, tradimento! Le vostre parole ben si accoppiano alle vostre azioni, anche troppo bene. Non mi sarei mai dovuto fidare di voi.

You disappoint me, {playername}. There were three groups of serfs that I charged you to return. Three, not {reg17}. I suppose the ones who did come back shall have to work twice as hard to make up for those that got away. As for your reward, {playername}, I'll only pay you for the serfs you returned, not the ones you let fly. Here. Take it, and let this business be done.
Grazie, {s65}. Siete davvero generoso.
Bah, è stato uno spreco del mio tempo.

{playername}, I was told that you crushed the bandits at my village of {s5}. Please know that I am most grateful to you for that. Please, let me pay the expenses of your campaign. Here, I hope these {reg14} peningas will be adequate.
Nessun problema, {s65}.
Felice di avervi servito.
È stato un gioco da ragazzi.

Damn it, {playername}. I heard that you were unable to drive off the bandits from my village of {s5}. Thanks to you, my village now lies in ruins. Everyone said that you were a capable warrior, but apparently, they were wrong.
Ah, {playername}. You bring {reg13} head of cattle, as I requested. Thanks to you, we will soon be ready to move on the Saxons.
Ah, {playername}. You bring {reg13} head of cattle, as I requested. Thanks to you, this will help us keep fed a greater number of men.
Ah, {playername}. My quartermaster has informed me of your delivery, {reg13} head of cattle, as I requested. I'm impressed.
Nessun problema, {s65}.
Felice di avervi servito.
Un gioco da ragazzi...
Avete buone capacità d'esplorazione, {playername}. Il mio messaggero mi ha appena portato il rapporto della vostra perlustrazione a {s13}, {s14} e {s15}. Ben fatto!
Un compito semplice, {s65}.
Non ho incontrato difficoltà insormontabili.
Piacere mio, signore.

The army's supplies are dwindling too quickly, {playername}. I need you to bring me {reg3} head of cattle so I can keep the troops fed. I care very little about where you get them. Just bring them to me as soon as you can.
Certamente, posso trovarvi il bestiame che richiedete.
Spiacente, signore, altre incombenze me lo impediscono.
Eccellente! Sapete cosa fare, {playername}. Ho bisogno di bestiame il più presto possibile.
That... is unfortunate, {playername}. I shall have to find someone else who's up to the task. Please go now. I've work to do.
Grazie per aver risposto alla convocazione, {playername}. Tuttavia, poichè ora siamo in pace, non abbiamo più bisogno dei vostri servigi. Potete tornare ad occuparvi dei vostri affari.
Ah, eccovi infine, {playername}. Vi stavamo aspettando. Spero che abbiate portato con voi le truppe richieste e con sufficiente esperienza.
Ho una buona Compagnia, di uomini forti e addestrati. Siamo pronti ad unirci a voi.
Non ho ancora un numero sufficiente di uomini. Avrò bisogno di altro tempo.

Excellent. We'll be moving soon. Now -- you are a {reg59?warrior:man} of sound judgment, and we trust that you will do what is necessary to support our campaign. I do not require you to remain close at hand, and I will not count it against you if you believe that your forces would be of better use elsewhere. But if you do choose to remain with me, to support me in battle, that would be appreciated. I may also have additional tasks for you to perform.
Fate in fretta. Ci muoveremo presto contro il nemico ed ho bisogno di ogni combattente capace che si possa chiamare a raccolta.

{playername}, ho bisogno di una persona che si offra volontaria per perlustrare un'area. Non abbiamo abbastanza informazioni, voglio avere la situazione chiara prima di procedere. Dovrete andare a {s13}, {s14} e {s15} e riportami qualunque informazione utile.
Avete trovato la persona giusta, signore.
Con grande rammarico, debbo rifiutare.
Good {reg59?lass:man}! Simply pass near {s13}, {s14} and {s15} and check out what's there. Make a note of anything you find and return to me as soon as possible.
Uhm. Sono deluso, {playername}. Molto deluso. Parleremo più tardi, adesso ho bisogno di trovare qualcuno che perlustri la zona.
Vi siete rivelata una persona veramente utile, {playername}. I miei ringraziamenti.
È sempre un onore servirvi.
I think you owe me {reg1} peningas, {playername}. Do you intend to pay your debt anytime soon?
That is why I came, {s65}. Here is every pening I owe you.
Alas, I don't have sufficient funds, {s65}, but I'll pay you soon enough.
Ah, excellent. You are a {reg59?woman:man} of honour, {playername}. I am satisfied. Your debt to me has been paid in full.
Bene, non mi fate aspettare molto.
By the way, I hope you get a chance to meet my {s11}, {s14}.
A proposito, sono sicuro che mia {s11}, {s14}, ne sarebbe contento se voi le faceste visita. Ella vi aspetta nelle sue stanze.

I heard that you have captured our enemy {s3} and he is with you at the moment. I can pay you {reg6} peningas if you want to get rid of him. You can wait for his family to pay his ransom of course, but there is no telling how long that will take, eh?
I accept your offer. I'll leave {s3} to you for {reg6} peningas.
Mi spiace ma non posso accettare la vostra offerta.
Excellent! Here's your {reg6} peningas. I'll send some men to take him to our prison with due haste.
Mmm. Come desiderate, {playername}, ma non troverete un'offerta migliore, sappiatelo.
Alzo un {s5} alla vostra salute, {playername}! Siete molto gentile ad ospitarci in quest'occasione. Desiderate dirmi qualcosa?
To your health, {reg59?your Highness:sire}. Long may you reign. What is your bidding?
Qual è la vostra offerta?
Desidero darvi il benvenuto nella mia sala in questa lieta occasione. Desiderate dirmi qualcosa?
Solleviamo un {s5} alla salute del nostro ospite, {s4}. Desiderate dirmi qualcosa?
I received the gift, presented to me through my {s11}, {s10}. It was a noble gesture, {reg59?my lady:sir}, and I regret that we ever quarreled.
I received the gift, presented to me through my {s11}, {s10}. For {reg4?her:his} sake, I am willing to let bygones be bygones.
I received the gift, presented to me through my {s11}, {s10}. Bah! Do you think you can buy my friendship?
I received the gift, presented to me through my {s11}, {s10}. As dear as {reg4?she:he} is to me, however, I cannot forget our differences.
Di che si tratta?
But enough talking. Yield or fight!
Nient'altro?
Nient'altro?
I heard that your feasts are wonderful!
We need to talk about the jarl of Kennemer.
I wish to talk about the jarl of Kennemer.
I wish to talk about the jarl of Kennemer.
Thank you, King Horik. I brought with me Brunhild and Bodo. They are trustworthy.
Let me tell you my story...
Yes, yes, nice to meet them. Now, to the point. My time is limited.
Recently, the boat I was traveling on was attacked by Vikings of Sven Bull Neck, a man of Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye.'

{s2}^^That is nothing special. Many jarls in Danmark have people who make themselves Vikings. Even the jarls and I were Vikings once. I hope you're not wasting my time... Choose your words carefully, or this conversation is over.
Sven Bull Neck has captured my mother, and he has brought her to Sigurd.
Sigurd tried to make the jarl of Kennemer king of Friese in exchange for an army.
My companion Bodo had something important from the king of Asturias that Sigurd wanted.
Sven Bull Neck has a hideout near Ribe, where he took the Woden Ric prisoners.
Sven Bull Neck and Sigurd 'Snake in the Eye' are up to something, and I want to stop them.
{s2}^^Your mother? This is because Sigurd took your mother? You have wasted my time. I will not talk more. It's time for you to go.

{s2}^^An army? This is your mystery? He is gathering men for Englaland, in the aid of my brothers. I myself have allowed my jarls and hersirs to join the expedition if they wish. Englaland is a rich land, inhabited by habitually weak people, waiting to be dominated and plundered by their betters. +You have wasted my time. I will not talk more. It's time for you to go.
{s2}^^You tell me things I already know, and you do not interest me. My patience has a limit, and you have quickly reached it. +You have wasted my time. I will not talk more. It's time for you to go.
Our meeting is over.
Sven and Sigurd are hated and feared by many men. The question is if they are up to something that could affect me.
Sven Bull Neck has my mother, and he has brought her to Sigurd.
Sigurd tried to make the jarl of Kennemer king of Friese in exchange for an army.
My companion Bodo had something important from the king of Asturias that Sigurd wanted.
Sven Bull Neck has a hideout near Ribe, where he took the Woden Ric prisoners.

I guess I can no longer maintain the secret, but this is not the place, nor are you the person. However, if I do not speak now, the danger is worse and could be terrible.^^The attack on the Woden Ric was no random act of piracy.

My name is Bodo Vimaraniz from Malacoria, in Cantabria. I come from King Aldefonso of Asturias. I was sent north with a present for Aethelred, king of West Seaxe. This present and I are the reason Sven Bull Neck attacked the Woden Ric. Sigurd Ragnarsson wants this present for himself, because he wants to be the king of Danmark while his brothers are kings in Englaland.
I know that Sigurd wants to be king. How could a gift give him my throne?

The Ragnarssons are powerful men, with lands in many places, like Danmark, Sweoland and now Northhymbre. Right now, it seems that their efforts are against Englaland, and they are, but this means ensuring that Danmark provide easy access to resources and warriors. If Sigurd is king here, he will guarantee all that. Moreover, now he can unite the Danish, for the gift I was carrying was the sword of Ragnar Lodbrok. His sons, Bjorn Ironside and Haesten, lost it when a Muslim fleet defeated them south of Al-Andalus.
How did you get the sword from the Muslims?
Bodo, I'm impressed. You know a lot about the Danish. What are you not telling me?
(Say nothing)
It was a gift to my king made by the emir of Al-Andalus in exchange for valuable prisoners. Aethelred, king of West Seaxe, was very interested in this sword, and my king Aldefonso got it for him.
I have been before in the north, but this is not important now.

Ragnar was more than a man. The skalds revere him as god, and the men feed their souls with his legend. Sigurd could carry the sword to the Assembly and claim the merit of recovering it. He might demand to be king and even kill me, and everyone might just forgive him for having recovered his father's sword. Ragnar's sword must be destroyed before anyone knows it exists.
Then maybe we can make a deal: sword for support.
(Brunhild seems to want to say something. Let her.)
I have business with Sigurd and Sven. I want your protection and support when I need it.

Yes, this is what we do. That sword cannot come to light, but we need to be cautious. Sigurd Ragnarsson is a shrewd man, and he won't attack openly.
